assessAndMonitor.defaultMessage: Assess and monitor the compliance of your RHEL systems using Policies
assessAndMonitor.description: Assess and monitor the compliance of your RHEL systems using Policies

authMethod.defaultMessage: BASIC/CERT - This parameter is used to set the authentication method for the Portal. Default behavior is BASIC. Note: when 'auto_config' is enabled (set to True), CERT will be used if RHSM or Satellite is detected.

autoConfig.defaultMessage: True/False - attempt to auto-configure the network connection with Satellite or RHSM. Default behavior is True.

automationNote.defaultMessage: Note: You can automate the installation and registration of systems with Ansible, included with your Red Hat Enterprise Linux entitlement.

combineTheFlexible.defaultMessage: Combines the flexible and powerful infrastructure management capabilities of Red Hat Satellite with the ability to execute remediation plans from Red Hat Insights
combineTheFlexible.description: Combines the flexible and powerful infrastructure management capabilities of Red Hat Satellite with the ability to execute remediation plans from Red Hat Insights

configureBasicAuthStep1.defaultMessage: Modify the auto_config= value to FALSE
configureBasicAuthStep1.description: Modify the auto_config= value to FALSE

configureBasicAuthStep2.defaultMessage: Add your Red Hat SSO username to username
configureBasicAuthStep2.description: Add your Red Hat SSO username to username

configureBasicAuthStep3.defaultMessage: Add your Red Hat SSO password to password
configureBasicAuthStep3.description: Add your Red Hat SSO password to password

deployInsightsOnCloudInfra.defaultMessage: Deploy Red Hat Insights on your cloud infrastructure
deployInsightsOnCloudInfra.description: Deploy Red Hat Insights on your cloud infrastructure title

deployInsightsOnCloudText.defaultMessage: The following guidance is user who wish to deploy Red Hat Insights on an existing, cloud marketplace-purchased Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) system managed by Red Hat Update Infrastructure (RHUI). This include on-demand, hourly systems purchased from CCSP marketplace, as well as systems deployed from Red Hat Gold Images in AWS. This procedure involves the following tasks:
deployInsightsOnCloudText.description: Deploy Red Hat Insights on your cloud infrastructure text

deployRHI.defaultMessage: Deploy Red Hat Insights using Puppet in Satellite
deployRHI.description: Deploy Red Hat Insights using Puppet in Satellite

deployingRHInsights.defaultMessage: Deploying Red Hat Insights using the Ansible Role included with your Smart Management entitlement
deployingRHInsights.description: Deploying Red Hat Insights using the Ansible Role included with your Smart Management entitlement

detectAndNotify.defaultMessage: Detect and be notified of system configuration changes using Custom Policies
detectAndNotify.description: Detect and be notified of system configuration changes using Custom Policies

displayNameFour.defaultMessage: If defined to be a non-empty string, this role will replace any previously set display name for the system with the given string.

displayNameOne.defaultMessage: Sets or resets the Display Name/System Name within Insights. Insights needs an easily identifiable name for each system. If no explicit display name is given to a system, Insights uses it's hostname. If a system's hostname is not easily identifiable, like "localhost" or "d4098731408", you can give it a better name by setting 'insights_display_name.'

displayNameThree.defaultMessage: If defined (set) to be the empty string, this role will remove any previously set display name for the system, and cause it to use the systems hostname as it's Display name/System name.

displayNameTwo.defaultMessage: If undefined (not set at all), this role will not make changes to a system's display name.

dynamicInventory.defaultMessage: Generate an Ansible inventory on system inventory which fluctuates over time. Also track hosts from multiple sources.

enablingInsightsOnRhuiParagraph1.defaultMessage: You must have a Red Hat account. If you've used RHEL on-demand through a public cloud marketplace but have never interacted with Red Hat directly, you can create an account by {createRedHatAccountInstructions}.
enablingInsightsOnRhuiParagraph1.description: Enabling Insights on RHUI/Cloud marketplace text first paragraph

enablingInsightsOnRhuiParagraph2.defaultMessage: If you're using a Red Hat subscription to entitle your RHEL system, you must enable the subscription for Red Hat Cloud Access. Learn how to in the {cloudAccessDocumentation}.
enablingInsightsOnRhuiParagraph2.description: Enabling Insights on RHUI/Cloud marketplace text second paragraph

factsInstalledOne.defaultMessage: This role installs a new fact 'insights' that provides the system's Insights' System Id. This System Id can be used to query about the system with the Insights Service API.
factsInstalledOne.description: Part one of facts installed description

factsInstalledTwo.defaultMessage: Once this role is run against a system, any future playbook run against that same system will have the system's Insights System Id in the fact 'ansible_local.insights.system_id'.
factsInstalledTwo.description: Part two of facts installed description

howToAccess.defaultMessage: How to access Red Hat Insights through a firewall/Proxy
howToAccess.description: How to access Red Hat Insights through a firewall/Proxy

ifYouHaveProblems.defaultMessage: If you have problems connecting to Red Hat Insights, ensure that your certificates are up-to-date. Refresh your subscription manifest to update your certificates.
ifYouHaveProblems.description: If you have problems connecting to Red Hat Insights, ensure that your certificates are up-to-date. Refresh your subscription manifest to update your certificates.

insightsProxy.defaultMessage: If the insights client is behind a proxy or firewall, a proxy can be specified. Default is unspecified. Ex: http://user:pass@192.168.100.50:8080

insightsRegistrationAssistant.defaultMessage: The Insights registration assistant will guide you through the setup process for the Red Hat Insights Client. You will be prompted with a series of questions about your environment to provide you with setup instructions tailored for your environment.

insightsWithBasicAuthNote.defaultMessage: Note: To read more about using Red Hat Insights with basic authentication and recommended best practices, {visitOurDocumentation}.
insightsWithBasicAuthNote.description: Note about Insights with basic authentication

installAndConfigure.defaultMessage: Install and configure your puppet module
installAndConfigure.description: Install and configure your puppet module

installInsightsClient.defaultMessage: Install the Insights client on each system
installInsightsClient.description: Install the Insights client on each system

installSystemRoles.defaultMessage: Installing RHEL System Roles and Ansible

installTheClient.defaultMessage: Install the client and register your systems to Red Hat Insights
installTheClient.description: Install the client and register your systems to Red Hat Insights

operatingSystemNote.defaultMessage: Note: Red Hat Insights can be used on all {rhSupported} of Red Hat Enterprise Linux, version 6.4 and later.

pleaseIndicate.defaultMessage: Please indicate how your systems are managed.
pleaseIndicate.description: Please indicate how your systems are managed.

puppetAutomatedInstall.defaultMessage: If you are using Red Hat Satellite's configuration management provided by puppet this process can be automated by applying the preinstalled Puppet class {class}. This class can be imported from the Puppet Master into the appropriate Puppet environment and applied to hosts that you wish to subscribe to Red Hat Insights.
puppetAutomatedInstall.description: Text for rhsm puppet automated installation

puppetAutomatedInstallMoInfo.defaultMessage: For more information on this topic, refer to the Creating a Host Group chapter in the official Satellite 6 User Guide.
puppetAutomatedInstallMoInfo.description: Text for rhsm puppet automated installation mo info

pythonInterpreterOne.defaultMessage: This variable allows you to provide the python interpreter path for ansible to use. This is needed when managing RHEL 8 with older versions of Ansible (2.7 and lower).

registerRhsmText.defaultMessage: You must register all Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) systems with Red Hat Subscription Manager to receive necessary updates and to resolve software dependencies.
registerRhsmText.description: Red Hat Subscription Manager text body

registerRhsmTextNote.defaultMessage: Note: If the system cannot be subscribed to RHSM, {basicAuth} can be configured on the client.
registerRhsmTextNote.description: Red Hat Subscription Manager text note

registerRhsmTextNoteAfter.defaultMessage: If you have a web-based proxy between your system and the Internet, you can configure the insights-client to connect through it. For more information, refer to {howToAccess}.
registerRhsmTextNoteAfter.description: Red Hat Subscription Manager text note after

registerYourSystems.defaultMessage: Register your systems with Red Hat Insights

rhsChooseConfigStepFour.defaultMessage: See host on the Insights > Overview page of the Satellite web UI

rhsChooseConfigStepOne.defaultMessage: Add the RedHatInsights.insights-client role to the hosts. {newLine} For new hosts, see {linkOne}. {newLine} For existing hosts, see {linkTwo}.
rhsChooseConfigStepOne.description: Add the RedHatInsights.insights-client role to the hosts

rhsChooseConfigStepThree.defaultMessage: Click the Run Ansible roles button.

rhsChooseConfigStepTwo.defaultMessage: To run the RedHatInsights.insights-client role on your host, navigate to Hosts > All Hosts and click the name of the host that you want to use.

rolesAndConfig.description: Roles and Configuration title for tabs

rolesAndConfigDescription.defaultMessage: The following variables can be used to perform some initial configuration for the insights-client install. These variables can be passed directly with the playbook invocation or placed in a configuration yaml file. See the section 'Example Playbook' for information on various ways to use these variables.
rolesAndConfigDescription.description: Roles and Configuration Description for tabs

sectionTwo.defaultMessage: Section 2.1, "Creating a Host in Red Hat Satellite"

staticInventory.defaultMessage: Ansible works against multiple managed hosts in your infrastructure at the same time, using host lists known as inventory.

stepNumberTitle.description: Step number and title is variable

stepOneTitle.defaultMessage: Step 1: Tell us about your systems

subscribeSatellite.defaultMessage: Subscribe hosts to the Satellite server
subscribeSatellite.description: Subscribe hosts to the Satellite server

subscribeSatelliteBody.defaultMessage: This step is typically already performed as par of Satellite host configuration. Only RHEL hosts registered to the particular Satellite server will have reports available in the Satellite UI.
subscribeSatelliteBody.description: Subscribe hosts to the Satellite server -body

toApply.defaultMessage: To apply any system updates to the Red Hat Insights plug-in, enter httpd restart after updating.
toApply.description: To apply any system updates to the Red Hat Insights plug-in, enter httpd restart after updating.

toView.defaultMessage: To view the logs for Red Hat Insights and all plug-ins, go to /var/log/foreman/production.log.
toView.description: To view the logs for Red Hat Insights and all plug-ins, go to /var/log/foreman/production.log.

useAutomation.defaultMessage: Do you wish to use automation for installation?

userPassFive.defaultMessage: These credentials are only necessary if the client system is not registered with Red Hat Subscription Manager. If the username and password are not set in the Insights configuration, which is the default initial state, all interactions with the Insights server will use the CERT provided by RHSM.
userPassFive.description: Part five of redhat_portal username and password

userPassFour.defaultMessage: If the {key} is set in the Insights configuration, it will be used as credentials for all future interactions with the Insights server.
userPassFour.description: Part four of redhat_portal username and password

userPassOne.defaultMessage: If defined, this sets, changes, or removes the {key} in the Insights configuration. If undefined, this role will make no changes to the Insights configuration.
userPassOne.description: Part one of redhat_portal username and password

userPassThree.defaultMessage: These should be valid {key} for Insights/Red Hat Portal/Red Hat Subscription Manager.
userPassThree.description: Part three of redhat_portal username and password

userPassTwo.defaultMessage: If defined to a non-empty string this role will set or change the {key}. If defined to an empty string this role will remove the {key}.
userPassTwo.description: Part two of redhat_portal username and password

verifySatellite.defaultMessage: Verify Satellite server connection to Red Hat Insights
verifySatellite.description: Verify Satellite server connection to Red Hat Insights

verifySatelliteNote.defaultMessage: Satellite organization with Red Hat Insights must be operating in Connected mode. Any firewalls or proxies through which the Satellite server communicates to Red Hat must allow https communications to {link}.
verifySatelliteNote.description: Satellite organization with Red Hat Insights must be operating in Connected mode. Any firewalls or proxies through which the Satellite server communicates to Red Hat must allow https communications to {link}.

verifySatelliteStepOne.defaultMessage: In the Satellite UI, navigate to Insights > Manage.
verifySatelliteStepOne.description: In the Satellite UI, navigate to Insights > Manage.

verifySatelliteStepTwo.defaultMessage: Verify under Insights Engine Connection that the status is Connected and the Account Number field displays the correct information for your organization.
verifySatelliteStepTwo.description: Verify under Insights Engine Connection that the status is Connected and the Account Number field displays the correct information for your organization.

youCanAutomate.defaultMessage: You can automate the installation and registration of hosts with Red Hat Insights using the {role} Ansible role. For more information about adding this role to your Satellite, see {link}.
youCanAutomate.description: You can automate the installation and registration of hosts with Red Hat Insights using the {role} Ansible role. For more information about adding this role to your Satellite, see {link}.

youCanChange.defaultMessage: You can change the default schedule for running insights-client by configuring insights-client.timer on a host. For more information, see {link} in the Client Configuration Guide for Red Hat Insights.
